meanings.definition: The state or capacity of being everywhere, especially at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The ubiquities of technology make it easy to communicate across long distances.
meanings.sent2: The ubiquities of nature can be seen in the different ecosystems around the world.
meanings.sent3: In a world of constant connectivity, the ubiquities of social media are hard to escape.
meanings.sent4: The ubiquities of love and kindness can brighten even the darkest days.
meanings.sent5: His paintings captured the ubiquities of human emotion in vivid colors.

meanings.definition: Things that are found or exist everywhere.
meanings.sent1: The ubiquities of fast food chains can be seen on almost every street corner.
meanings.sent2: The ubiquities of laughter and joy bring people together in times of celebration.
meanings.sent3: She joked that the ubiquities of socks disappearing in the laundry were actually a conspiracy.
meanings.sent4: The ubiquities of music in our lives create a soundtrack to our memories.
meanings.sent5: The artist's work reflected the ubiquities of beauty in everyday life.
